intro: Paeonia intermedia subsp. pamiroalaica, commonly known as the Pamir peony, is a rare and distinctive member of the芍药 family (Paeoniaceae). It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Pamir Mountains in Central Asia, where it thrives in cold, arid environments. The plant features showy, double flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky down. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and its role in the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
